title: Lions' Norris stable after injury ends game early
content: A preseason game between the Lions and Falcons was suspended in the fourth quarter after Detroit safety Morice Norris was taken off the field in an ambulance.

title: Sanders impresses for Browns, felt 'comfortable'
content: Browns quarterback Shedeur Sanders didn't disappoint in his highly anticipated NFL preseason debut against the Panthers.

title: Yanks' Williams on latest loss: 'I stink right now'
content: Yankees reliever Devin Williams summed up another poor outing by telling reporters, "It's pretty simple. I stink right now."

title: Geno, Crosby flash obscene gestures at hecklers
content: Raiders quarterback Geno Smith and defensive end Maxx Crosby were caught on video making obscene gestures toward Seahawks fans.

title: Wrexham stunned by late Southampton goals
content: Wrexham suffered a double gut punch as Southampton struck twice late on for a dramatic 2-1 victory at St Mary's.

content: Clayton Kershaw outpitched Max Scherzer in a matchup for the ages, as Mookie Betts homered and drove in three runs to lead the Dodgers past the Blue Jays 5-1.

content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: üèÄ Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses

title: üèà ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: üëä Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: 'I'm made for it': Austin Simmons gets his shot at Ole Miss
content: At 19, the two-sport star has already graduated from Ole Miss, but he's getting his first chance to start at QB.

title: 12 colleges stacked with NFL draft talent: Why scouts are watching Penn State, Clemson this season
content: Which schools have the best talent for next year's draft? We picked 12 must-watch rosters loaded with potential future first-rounders.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle tell Isak he can't leave to join Liverpool
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak has been told he cannot leave the club for Liverpool this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: Eight years late, Bengaluru metro‚Äôs Yellow Line ready to run
content: The project was initially scheduled for completion by December 2021 but was plagued by a series of setbacks, including delays in land acquisition, the COVID-19 pandemic, and hold-ups in rolling stock supply from the Chinese manufacturer CRRC Nanjing

title: Four Bangladeshi men held after armed robbery attempt in Meghalaya
content: The incident happened at a border village in the South West Khasi Hills district; Police, BSF launch search for five others from cross-border gang

title: Caste Hindus begin razing ‚Äòuntouchability wall‚Äô in Karur after revenue officials, police intervene
content: Members of the intermediate caste initially refused to tear down the wall claiming that the wall was meant to prevent anti-social activities by ‚Äòoutsiders‚Äô under the influence of alcohol. The Arunthathiyar community alleged the wall was raised to prevent access to areas where the caste Hindus lived

title: Systematic pattern of mischief in maintaining electoral rolls: Kamal Nath
content: The Congress leader underlined the demand for machine-readable electoral rolls to be given to parties by citing how he had raised issues regarding voter lists in Madhya Pradesh back in 2018

title: Chandrababu Naidu aims to see poverty-free A.P. by 2029
content: Minister Narayana announced that 11 government high schools in Nellore will be renovated by next academic year

title: Ramalinga Reddy slams BJP for taking credit for metro project, says Karnataka‚Äôs contribution much higher
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy on Saturday hit out at BJP leaders, including State president B.Y. Vijayendra and MP for Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya, for claiming that the Yellow Line ‚Äî set to be inaugurated on August 10¬†‚Äî¬†was solely a Central government initiative.

title: Questions from Supreme Court‚Äôs chastisement of a High Court judge
content: The recent chastisement raises two questions, whether the top court can act as an ‚Äòelder brother‚Äô to High Courts and if ‚Äòinstitutional concerns affecting rule of law‚Äô would give the top court authority to intervene in the exclusive ‚Äòmaster of roster‚Äô powers of the Chief Justice of a State High Court

title: Damaged road makes daily commute torturous in Vellaikoil
content: Residents have sought a separate ration shop for Vellakoil, pointing out that they had to travel nearly 2 km to Perumal Pettai to collect their rations

title: South Korean delegation wants Gadag delared as ‚Äòpeace district‚Äô
content: Delegates from South Korea based global peace organisation Heavenly Culture, World Peace, Restoration of Light (HWPL)¬†visited Mahatma Gandhi Rural Development and Panchayat Raj University in Gadag on Saturday and had a dialogue with Minister for Law, Justice, Human Rights, Parliamentary Affairs, Legislative Affairs and Tourism H. K. Patil.

title: Chhattisgarh government to launch Gaudham Yojana for stray cattle protection
content: Scheme to focus on curbing illegal trafficking; will effectively replace the Baghel government‚Äôs Gauthan Yojana

title: Decision on revival of G.O. 3 soon, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: As per the G.O., which was quashed by the Apex court, only local tribal people are eligible for government jobs in the Scheduled Areas; NDA Government striving to improve infrastructure, raise living standards, and boost the incomes of the tribal communities, he says

title: Overall development of tribal people important for A.P.‚Äôs growth: NTR Collector
content: Focus is on development of infrastructure in tribal areas, and ashram schools are being set up to provide quality education to tribal students, says G. Lakshmish

title: Schiller vs Miller: Who is the 'Trump whisperer'? The duel shaping tariffs on India, Pak
content: Washington's political landscape is now defined by 'ins' and 'outs,' impacting India's lobbying efforts amid tariff disputes. Despite hiring Jason Miller, India faces challenges as Pakistan's lobbyist, Keith Schiller, gains perceived influence with President Trump. Trump favors direct engagement from foreign leaders, potentially disadvantaging India's more reserved approach to negotiations.

title: 'Not an era of war': India welcomes US-Russia meet in Alaska
content: India has expressed its support for the upcoming summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025. The meeting is viewed as a promising step towards resolving the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, which began in February 2022.

title: 'I Was Shocked' ‚Äì When Samson left speechless by 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: Sanju Samson lauded Vaibhav Suryavanshi's impressive performance for Rajasthan Royals, recalling his own memorable innings as captain against Punjab Kings. However, recent tensions between Samson and the Royals' management have led to a trade or release request. Despite interest from teams like Chennai Super Kings, the Royals must decide whether to retain their captain.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: Rafael Nadal, wife Mery welcome second child - name also revealed
content: Rafael Nadal and his wife, Mery Perello, are now parents of two. They welcomed their second son, Miquel, in Palma. The name is a tribute to Mery's father. Miquel joins his older brother, Rafael Junior. Nadal retired from tennis last year. He is now focusing on family life and business.

title: BrahMos led offensive, Akashteer guarded skies: Weapons behind Op Sindoor
content: DRDO Chairman Samir V Kamat announced that India's BrahMos missiles and Akashteer air defence system played a crucial role in Operation Sindoor, the retaliatory strike following the Pahalgam terror attack. BrahMos, launched from Sukhoi Mk 1 aircraft, served as the primary offensive weapon, while Akashteer acted as the defensive backbone, integrating sensors to neutralize threats.

title: 'Ghost of Balakot‚Äô laid to rest: Air Force chief on why videos of Operation Sindoor matter - watch
content: Air Force Chief Marshal AP Singh voiced his regret over the absence of video evidence from the 2019 Balakot airstrike, which fueled doubts among opposition leaders regarding its effectiveness. He highlighted that Operation Sindoor addressed this issue by providing recorded footage of airstrikes, effectively dispelling the "ghost of Balakot.

title: GTA 6 release date set for May 2026: Innovative gameplay promises new thrills
content: Grand Theft Auto 6 is slated for a May 26, 2026, release, fueling excitement tempered by Rockstar's history of delays. While Take-Two Interactive anticipates significant revenue driven by GTA 6, the game's pricing may reflect the rising costs of AAA titles. Players can anticipate an expansive open-world experience with innovative gameplay and a compelling narrative.

title: Samson recalls Gambhir's warning: 'I‚Äôll remove you from team only if ... '
content: Sanju Samson's career, marked by pivotal support from figures like Suryakumar Yadav and Gautam Gambhir, reached new heights in 2024 with three T20I centuries. Despite his international success, his IPL future with Rajasthan Royals is uncertain. Differences have led Samson to request a trade, but the Royals control his fate.

title: On Sharad Pawar's 160 ‚Äòguaranteed‚Äô seats claim, CM's 'timing' reply
content: Sharad Pawar claimed that before the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections, two individuals promised him 160 seats, a claim that adds weight to Rahul Gandhi's allegations of electoral malpractice. Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of favoring the BJP, citing irregularities in voter turnout and voter list discrepancies in Maharashtra and Karnataka.

title: 'Over 200 arrested': London police crackdown on a pro-Palestinian group
content: London police have arrested approximately 200 individuals for openly defying a new law that bans public support for the pro-Palestinian group, Palestine Action. The arrests occurred after demonstrators displayed placards in support of the group, which was outlawed in July and classified as a terrorist organization.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at GPT-5 launch: ‚ÄòIndia is our second-largest market‚Ä¶but‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: OpenAI has launched GPT-5, its most advanced AI model, boasting significant improvements in accuracy, speed, and reasoning. CEO Sam Altman highlighted India as a rapidly growing market, potentially surpassing the US. GPT-5 is available in various sizes and tiers, including a free version, with enhanced versions for Team, Enterprise, Edu, and Pro users, marking a step towards Artificial General Intelligence.

title: Watch: Siraj, Asha Bhosle's granddaughter Zanai celebrate Rakhi together
content: Mohammed Siraj celebrated Raksha Bandhan with Zanai Bhosle, clarifying their brother-sister bond after dating rumors. Siraj's impressive performance on the England tour, where he took 23 wickets, has garnered praise. Wasim Akram lauded Siraj's passion and stamina, noting his evolution into a leading bowler for the Indian team, showcasing remarkable mental strength.

title: Earthquake strikes Russia: 6.1 magnitude tremor jolts Kurli Islands
content: A 6.1 magnitude earthquake hit the Kuril Islands on Saturday. The National Center for Seismology reported the event. The quake occurred at a depth of 10 km. Its epicenter was at latitude 49.94¬∞N and longitude 162.70¬∞E. This follows an 8.8 magnitude earthquake off Russia‚Äôs Kamchatka Peninsula. A 5.1 magnitude tremor also occurred near Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky recently.

title: Former Pakistan pacer makes massive Siraj admission: 'He's not just ...'
content: Wasim Akram hails Mohammed Siraj's transformation from a support bowler to India's pace spearhead after his match-winning performance at the Oval. Siraj's nine wickets helped India level the series against England, showcasing his stamina and mental fortitude by bowling over 185 overs.

title: McDavid and Lauren Kyle steal the show at Draisaitl‚Äôs fairytale wedding
content: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle captivated fans with their charm and elegance at a Provence wedding, overshadowing rumors of another NHL star's nuptials. Lauren's Instagram posts offered a genuine glimpse into the dreamy festivities, showcasing understated style and heartfelt moments. Fans celebrated the couple's natural chemistry and the weekend's blend of style, love, and authentic connection.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Navratilova: Chris Evert‚Äôs Catholic upbringing shaped her tennis image
content: Martina Navratilova's comments sparked renewed interest in Chris Evert. Navratilova suggested Evert's strict Catholic upbringing shaped her public image. She contrasted this with her own experiences growing up in Czechoslovakia. Navratilova noted Evert's desire to please her parents influenced her behavior. The remarks added a new layer to their famous rivalry. Their contrasting styles fueled tennis's growth.

title: 1 yr of RG Kar incident: 'Bangles broken' - Victim's mother's big charge against WB cops
content: Kolkata witnessed police action against protesters during the ‚ÄòNabanna Abhijan‚Äô march. The rally commemorated the anniversary of a doctor's rape and murder at RG Kar Medical College. The victim's family alleged police obstruction despite court permission. Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari urged BJP workers to join. Security measures included barricades and traffic halts.

title: Evander Kane celebrates Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins‚Äô wedding in style
content: Evander Kane, former Oilers forward, attended Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins' wedding in France, sharing photos on Instagram with a heartfelt message. Accompanied by fianc√©e Mara Teigen, Kane joined other NHL stars like Connor Brown and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins at the lavish event. Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, was a bridesmaid.

title: 'Badi deewar gir gayi hai': Families recall Delhi wall collapse horror; 7 killed
content: In Jaitpur, a wall collapsed near Mohan Baba Mandir due to heavy rain, killing five members of Ranjan's family and trapping eight people in jhuggis. The victims included two children, a woman, and several migrant workers from West Bengal. Police are investigating the structural condition of the wall and potential negligence, while one survivor receives treatment.

title: Data network outage at Mumbai airport: Flight operations hit; Air India issues advisory
content: Air India reported that a data network outage at Mumbai Airport disrupted check-in systems, causing flight delays, including its own. While the issue has been resolved, Air India cautioned that some flights might still experience delays as operations gradually return to normal.

title: Hezbollah military facility explosion: 5 soldiers killed while clearing munitions
content: Five Lebanese soldiers tragically died in an explosion at a Hezbollah military facility near Majdal Zoun, Tyre district, while clearing munitions left over from the recent conflict with Israel. The facility was being dismantled by the Lebanese army under a November truce agreement.

title: 'Shot Pak plane from 300 km': IAF chief's big update on Op Sindoor - key revelations
content: IAF chief Amar Preet Singh revealed Operation Sindoor inflicted significant damage on Pakistan, including the downing of six aircraft, among them five fighter jets and a high-value surveillance platform. The operation targeted command and control centers, radar systems, and aircraft hangars, effectively addressing the 'ghost of Balakot' by showcasing tangible achievements and losses inflicted on the adversary.

title: ‚ÄòThey label kanwariyas as terrorists‚Äô: BJP calls Samajwadi Party ‚Äòcommunal‚Äô
content: The BJP has criticized the Samajwadi Party (SP), labeling it a "communal party" after former SP MP ST Hasan linked the Uttarkashi flash floods to religious intolerance in Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh. Hasan suggested a lack of respect for other religions contributed to the disaster, while the BJP condemned his remarks as insulting to Sanatan Dharma amidst a natural calamity.

title: WTC Table: How the standings look as NZ crush Zim ‚Äì Where does India stand?
content: New Zealand's massive innings victory over Zimbabwe in Bulawayo, though impressive, doesn't affect the current ICC World Test Championship standings as Zimbabwe isn't part of the cycle. India currently holds third place, while Australia leads the table.

title: US-India trade war: What triggered Trump's tariff attack on India - key reasons
content: Donald Trump's administration has escalated trade tensions with India, imposing tariffs due to energy ties with Russia and stalled trade negotiations. This move, coupled with disagreements over diplomatic interventions and strategic alignments, has strained US-India relations. India is cautiously navigating this complex situation, balancing economic interests with its commitment to strategic autonomy and an independent foreign policy.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Faissal's latest revelation, Kohli's beard worries netizens & more
content: Faissal Khan revealed his exclusion from 'The Kapil Sharma Show' appearance with Aamir Khan. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli's grey beard sparked varied reactions as he enjoys family time in London. Boney Kapoor shared a touching throwback photo of Sridevi ahead of her birth anniversary. Sooraj Barjatya hinted at Salman Khan's return as Prem in a future film.

title: England cricket legend Pietersen reveals ‚Äòbest Test series ever played‚Äô
content: Kevin Pietersen's declaration immortalises the 2005 Ashes as his career highlight and the greatest Test series ever. England's triumph, fueled by Pietersen's explosive century and a resilient team effort, marked a defining moment against a formidable Australian side. The series, filled with narrow victories and dramatic performances, etched itself into cricketing history, showcasing courage and flair.

title: 'Makes it even more shocking...': Cong questions PM after IAF chief's Op Sindoor revelations
content: Following the IAF chief's disclosure about Operation Sindoor, Congress leaders are questioning Prime Minister Modi's decision to halt the operation abruptly on May 10. Jairam Ramesh and Gaurav Gogoi have demanded answers regarding potential pressure or concessions influencing the decision.

title: Raksha Bandhan with the PM: Modi shares cute moment with children - pics
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Raksha Bandhan at his residence, sharing joyful moments with school children and members of Brahma Kumari. He conveyed greetings on X, highlighting the festival's role in strengthening sibling bonds. Union home minister Amit Shah and defence minister Rajnath Singh also extended wishes, emphasising the festival's significance in love, trust, protection, and commitment.

title: Samson wishes to leave RR because of 14-yo Vaibhav Suryavanshi?
content: Aakash Chopra speculates Sanju Samson's possible departure from Rajasthan Royals before the 2026 IPL auction, potentially influenced by Vaibhav Suryavanshi's emergence. Samson's desire to leave stems from team dynamics, with Kolkata Knight Riders emerging as a likely destination due to their need for an Indian wicketkeeper-batter and captaincy option. Chopra suggests roster changes to accommodate Samson at KKR.

title: Virat Kohli's goodbye gift that Mohammed Siraj will never forget
content: Mohammed Siraj treasures Virat Kohli's last Test jersey as a symbol of their deep bond, forged through shared battles and mutual respect. Kohli's mentorship transformed Siraj from a rookie into a key bowler for India. The jersey represents their friendship, loyalty, and Kohli's lasting impact on Siraj's career, inspiring both on and off the field.

title: 1 dead as fire breaks out at Delhi‚Äôs Anand Vihar hospital; 11 patients rescued
content: A fire erupted at a New Delhi hospital in Anand Vihar on Saturday due to a short circuit, triggering blasts in oxygen cylinders. The ensuing thick smoke compelled hospital staff to evacuate patients to Pushpanjali Hospital after breaking windows. Emergency services responded swiftly, and an investigation is currently underway to determine the exact cause of the incident.

title: ICICI bank raises minimum balance for new customers: Rs 50,000 in cities
content: ICICI Bank has raised the minimum average balance requirement for new savings accounts opened from August 1st. The new MAB is Rs 50,000 for metro/urban, Rs 25,000 for semi-urban, and Rs 10,000 for rural locations.

title: Record! NZ seal biggest Test victory; Zimbabwe suffer worst-ever defeat
content: New Zealand dominated Zimbabwe, securing their largest-ever Test victory by an innings and 359 runs, completing a 2-0 series sweep. Debutant Zakary Foulkes starred with a remarkable 9-75, setting a new record for a New Zealand bowler on debut. Zimbabwe struggled against New Zealand's pace attack, succumbing to their lowest series total, highlighting the gulf between the two teams.

title: IAF chief says India shot down 6 Pakistani aircraft; trashes Trump's claim
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh revealed that the Indian Air Force (IAF) successfully shot down five Pakistani jets and an AEW&C aircraft during Operation Sindoor. Speaking at a memorial lecture in Bengaluru, Singh's statement marks the first official confirmation of the extent of damage inflicted on Pakistani aircraft during the cross-border anti-terror operation.

title: From Iyer to Pant: India cricketers celebrate Raksha Bandhan - pics inside
content: Raksha Bandhan celebrations saw Indian cricket stars like Rishabh Pant and Shreyas Iyer spending time with their sisters. They shared heartwarming pictures on social media. Sakshi Pant tied rakhi to Rishabh. Shreyas Iyer posted a picture with his sister, Shresta Iyer. These moments showed the importance of family for these athletes.

title: 'Heard of Laapataa Ladies not of laapataa VP': Sibal on Dhankhar's whereabouts
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal has voiced concerns over the whereabouts of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, noting his absence from public view since his resignation on July 22, citing health reasons. Sibal urged Home Minister Amit Shah to address the matter, highlighting Dhankhar's incommunicado status and suggesting the possibility of filing a habeas corpus petition.

title: Gold again! Gukesh, Pranav and now this ‚Äî Velammal keeps minting talents
content: Velammal MHS School's chess team triumphed at the 2025 World Schools Team Championship, continuing India's chess dominance. The Chennai-based institution, known for nurturing chess talent like GMs D Gukesh and R Praggnanandhaa, provides academic flexibility and professional coaching. Velammal's success, fueled by Chennai's chess culture and support for players, solidifies its reputation as a "Chess Factory."

title: NYC Times Square shooting: 3 injured in gunfire after ‚Äòverbal dispute‚Äô
content: Early Saturday morning, a shooting in Times Square injured three individuals following a dispute. The New York Police Department reported that a 17-year-old male suspect was apprehended at the scene, and a firearm was recovered. The victims, a 65-year-old man, a 19-year-old man, and an 18-year-old woman, are in stable condition at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Dharali flash floods: FIR against 5 for 'Nature's bulldozer' comment
content: Dehradun police have registered a case against five individuals, including one unidentified person, for allegedly posting and commenting on a Facebook update about the Dharali flash floods. The post, captioned "this is nature's bulldozer," along with the comments, is accused of hurting religious sentiments and promoting enmity.

title: Udaipur shocker: Woman, mother-in-law burnt alive after dispute
content: In a tragic incident in Udaipur's Jindoli village, a woman, Mangi Gameti, and her mother-in-law, Pappa Bai, died after Mangi set herself on fire following a domestic dispute with her husband. The fire rapidly spread due to inflammable materials in the room, trapping both women.

title: Ahmedabad woman gets 2 years in jail for throwing baby from 9th floor
content: An Ahmedabad court convicted a 25-year-old woman to two years in jail for concealing the birth and disposing of her newborn child's body. Residents of Skywalk Society discovered the infant's body in April 2023, suspecting it was thrown from the ninth floor. While charged with murder, the prosecution failed to prove intent.

title: DCC president, LDF candidate allege large-scale voters‚Äô list manipulation in Thrissur LS poll
content: Joseph Tajet accuses BJP‚Äôs Suresh Gopi of orchestrating fraudulent entries; Sunilkumar questions returning officer‚Äôs role and claims deliberate misinformation

title: India welcomes Donald Trump-Vladimir Putin summit in Alaska
content: The meeting holds the promise of bringing to an end the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and opening up the prospects for peace, says Ministry of External Affairs

title: Government has disbursed ‚Çπ1,000 crore to families displaced by Polavaram project: MLA
content: CC roads, drainages and other works worth ‚Çπ85 crore have been taken up in the tribal villages in Eluru district, says Chirri Balaraju

title: Women, kin of deceased donors to get priority in organ transplant, says govt.
content: NOTTO has asked State governments to create permanent posts for transplant coordinators at hospitals that perform organ transplantation and consider training emergency responders and ambulance staff to identify potential deceased donors early

title: YSRCP general secretary alleges assassination plot by TDP leaders
content: Satish Kumar Reddy demands suo motu CBI probe into the alleged threat and accuses TDP leaders of intimidating journalists

title: Long list of boiling issues expected to dominate Monsoon Session of Karnataka legislature
content: The¬†Monsoon¬†Session¬†of the legislature¬†starting on Monday is expected to witness heated exchanges between the Congress and the BJP and the JD(S) on¬†many¬†boiling issues, including the allegation of vote theft, shortage of fertilizers, stampede at M. Chinnaswamy stadium, Special Investigation Team probe into alleged mass burials in Dharmasthala, and¬†‚Äúfailure‚Äù to maintain law and order.

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation‚Äôs climate budget outlines projects to reduce the city‚Äôs carbon footprint
content: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation‚Äôs climate budget focuses on sustainable projects to reduce carbon footprint, setting an example for other local bodies.

title: KITE launches online AI training for Lakshadweep teachers
content: The training module is an updated version of the AI programme previously conducted for 80,000 teachers in Kerala

title: Operation Sindoor was declaration of India‚Äôs self-reliance in defence sector: DRDO chief
content: ‚ÄúOperation Sindoor was more than a mission. It was a declaration of India‚Äôs ability to stand tall through self-reliance, strategic foresight, and indigenous technological strength. It was a statement to the world that India has the capability to protect its borders through homegrown technology,‚Äù DRDO chief Samir Kamat said

title: CPI(M) criticises Church leaders broadcasting affinity towards BJP despite Christian persecution
content: V.N. Vasavan visits the parents of Fr. Jijo, who was among the clergy targeted by the Bajrang Dal activists in Odisha, at the latter‚Äôs family home in Kuravalangadu in Kottayam

title: APMC files review petition in High Court seeking more time and clarity on July 9 judgment in FMGs‚Äô case
content: The verdict says that Permanent Registration should be given in one month to the FMGs who compensated all practical studies that they missed during the pandemic by taking up additional offline classes

title: Women‚Äôs forum urges Assam to withdraw move on arming civilians
content: The Nari Nagarik Manch warned that the move to grant arms licences to ‚Äúindigenous people in sensitive areas‚Äù will undo decades of peacebuilding and escalate tensions in the State

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: 287 more rescued as government deploys 4 choppers to evacuate stranded people
content: According to official data, more than 1,000 people have been evacuated so far from parts of the Dharali area which are still cut off following mudslide and flash floods on Tuesday

title: International workshop on research potential of Hortus Malabaricus begins in Thrissur
content: Meet to discuss the historical, ethnobotanical, and scientific relevance of Hortus Malabaricus ‚Äî the seminal 17th-century botanical work.

title: P. Jayarajan denies discontent in CPI(M) over M.V. Govindan‚Äôs visit to astrologer
content: Visual media circulates photograph of Govindan‚Äôs meeting with Madhava Poduval, a well-known astrologer, who is known for close ties across political lines

title: Kerala‚Äôs Muthuvan tribe comes together to protect their language, culture
content: Community organises three-day assembly as part of the International Day of the World‚Äôs Indigenous Peoples

title: Giving back land and life
content: The Gujarat police are helping borrowers crushed by loan sharks to reclaim their property and their peace of mind; In first six months of 2025, 315 cases registered against 756 moneylenders, arresting 638 of them for operating illegally and 23 people were arrested in Amreli district

title: Police register fresh case against father for ‚Äòselling‚Äô another girl child too
content: Mastan allegedly sold her for ‚Çπ30,000 to a couple from Vetapalem village two years ago, alleges wife

title: New freshwater crabs discovered in the Western Ghats in Kerala
content: The new species belong to the freshwater crab family Gecarcinucidae. While Kasargodia sheebae was spotted in the Ranipuram Hill Station in  Kasaragod district, the specimen of Pilarta vaman was collected from a small mountain stream at Gavi.

title: Naidu fabricated liquor scandal to settle scores with YSRCP cadre, alleges Tirupati MP
content: Gurumoorthy calls recent ‚Çπ11 crore seizure in Telangana a diversion tactic and condemns the arrest of YSRCP Lok Sabha Floor Leader Midhun Reddy

title: Trains cancelled, regulated, rescheduled for Vande Bharat launch in Bengaluru on August 10
content: PM Modi to inaugurate Karnataka‚Äôs first Vande Bharat train and the Yellow Line of Namma Metro, the South Western Railway on August 10

title: "Virat Kohli Also Called": When Village Shop Became Cricket World's Hotline
content: Imagine you're sitting at a grocery shop in your village when your phone rings. On the other end, a voice says, "Hello, I'm Virat Kohli." Moments later, another call, "This is AB de Villiers." Then another, "I'm Rajat Patidar."

title: Woman, 64, Pushed Off Moving Train, Robbed In Kerala
content: A 64-year-old woman was pushed off the slowly moving Sampark Kranti Express shortly after it left Kozhikode railway station and robbed of over Rs 8,000 in cash and a mobile phone, Railway police said on Saturday.

title: "Normal Parliamentary Procedure": Kiren Rijiju On New Income Tax Bill
content: Amid criticism of the new Income Tax Bill's withdrawal from the Lok Sabha, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that introducing a Bill in Parliament after necessary amendments is a normal procedure.

title: Pakistan Lost Rs 127 Crore In Two Months After Shutting Airspace For India: Report
content: Pakistan had closed its airspace for Indian aircraft a day after India suspended the Indus Water Treaty on 23rd April. Owing to that, Pakistan has suffered losses amounting to Rs 4.10 billion in two months.

title: India Endorses US-Russia Summit In Alaska, Cites PM Modi's Remark
content: The Ministry of External Affairs in a statement said that India welcomes the understanding between the US and Russia as Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that, "This is not an era of war".

title: 26 Chinese Nationals Arrested Over Illegal Loan Practices By Thai Police
content: Thai police said they arrested 26 Chinese nationals on Saturday on suspicion that they were running an illegal online loan operation.

title: More Images Show Battering That Pak Air Force Took In Operation Sindoor
content: Several new images of Pakistani military targets struck by India during Operation Sindoor clearly show the neighbouring country's forces, especially its air assets, took a sound beating.

title: Evacuation In Disaster-Hit Uttarakashi Underway, 816 Rescued So Far
content: After the devastating flash-floods that hit Dharali and Harsil, 816 civilians have been rescued by the Indian Army, Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), and State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) till Saturday

title: 6 Pak Aircraft Shot Down During Op Sindoor, Says Air Force Chief
content: Six Pakistani aircraft - including five fighter jets and another large aircraft - were downed during Operation Sindoor, the Indian Air Force has confirmed.

title: 2-Year-Old Dies Boy After Falling Into Sewer In Delhi
content: A two-and-a-half-year old boy died after falling into an open sewer in outer north Delhi's Khera Khurd village amid heavy rain Saturday morning, police said.

title: Chaos At RG Kar Protest: Victim's Parents Injured, Taken To Hospital
content: The parents of the RG Kar rape and murder victim have claimed that they roughed up by the state police this morning during a protest march to Nabanna, the state secretariat that houses the office of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

title: Won't Surrender Land To Buy Peace: Zelensky After US, Russia Agree To Summit
content: Ukraine won't surrender land to Russia to buy peace, President Volodymyr Zelensky warned Saturday, after Washington and Moscow agreed to hold a summit in a bid to end the war.

title: Sharad Pawar Claims 'Seat Guarantee' Offered Ahead Of Polls, D Fadnavis Says...
content: Sharad Pawar has claimed that ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly elections, two individuals approached him offering a "guarantee" of 160 seats for the Maha Vikas Aghadi, well above the 145 needed for a majority in the House.

title: "Will Make An Example Of Them": Iran Arrests 20 Alleged Israeli Spies
content: Iran has arrested 20 people it alleges are operatives of Israel's Mossad spy agency in recent months, the judiciary said on Saturday, warning that they will face no leniency and will be made an example of.

title: Assam Man's 25-Year Vintage Collection Now A Unique Museum
content: A government employee in Assam has transformed a 25-year passion for collecting vintage items into a unique private museum.

title: Waterslide Horror On World's Largest Cruise Ship, Screams Heard In Video
content: A terrifying incident unfolded on Royal Caribbean's Icon of the Seas when a waterslide suddenly cracked open mid-ride, leaving one injured.

title: 1 Dead, 10 Injured As Fire Breaks Out In Delhi Hospital
content: A fire broke out at Anand Vihar Hospital in east Delhi on Saturday afternoon, leaving one person dead and at least 10 injured, Delhi Fire Service officials said.

title: Sharad Pawar's '160 Seats Offer' Claim Follows Rahul Gandhi's Big Charge
content: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi's allegations of vote theft in Karnataka during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and the explosive claims against the Election Commission have found support from NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar.

title: Some Nations Will Make "Titanic Efforts" To Disrupt Putin-Trump Meeting: Russia
content: Certain countries will make "titanic efforts" to disrupt the meeting US President Donald Trump announced on Friday with Russian President Vladimir Putin for August 15, Russia's investment envoy Kirill Dmitriev said on Saturday.
